intro: Baissea atrobrunnea, commonly known as the dark brown baissea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dark brown to black bark and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in cymes. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Baissea atrobrunnea is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
